III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Behavior management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall include
Description all of the following:
(c) Written guidelines for informally resolving minor misbehavior.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 allegedly threw water on Youth A to wake them up in the
morning.
Investigation On 8/1/24, I left a voicemail for Complainant and Foster Care
Worker with no return call as of the date of this report.
On 8/1/24, I spoke to Administrator. Administrator reported Staff
1 was seen on camera putting ice on Youth A and a fake, toy
cockroach on Youth A to get her up in the morning. Administrator
reported they had placed Staff 1 on leave due to the investigation.
On 8/21/24 I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A has been struggling with waking up on time and
has been refusing to get up with the rest of the group. Supervisor
1 reported Youth A told her Staff 1 threw ice on her and put a fake
cockroach on her to wake her up. Supervisor 1 did not mention
Youth A reporting Staff 1 hit her. Supervisor 1 reported the normal
wake up procedures are, to turn the lights on, give each youth five
minutes to start to get up and then redirect them. Supervisor 1
reported if they don’t wake up, they are to fill out a refusal paper
letting staff and supervisors know they are refusing to get up.
Supervisor 1 reported this process is not written anywhere.
Supervisor 1 reported she did not see this happening and only
heard about it from Youth A.
On 8/21/24, I interviewed Youth A. Youth A reported Staff 1 threw
ice on her and hit her arm on one occasion. She also pulled her
blanket off of her and placed a fake cockroach on her to get her
up. Youth A reported this to Supervisor 1.
Staff 1 did not show up to her interview. On 8/29/24, I spoke to
Staff 1 on the phone, and she declined an interview. Staff 1 had
not been back to work since the alleged incident.
2

Video Reviewed:
• I watched the video dated 7/23/24 where Staff 1 allegedly
threw ice cubes at Youth A and placed a fake cockroach on
her. At 6:03am Staff 1 turned the lights on in Youth A’s
room. Youth A was lying in bed and had her left arm
outstretched with her palm cupped upwardly. Staff 1 is
seen engaging verbally with Youth A. Youth A did not get
out of bed. Staff 1 placed an ice cube in Youth A’s cupped
hand. Youth A threw them at Staff 1. Staff 1 left the room
and came back at 6:05am and placed another ice cube in
her hand and then left. At 6:06am, Staff 1 came back into
the room and took Youth A’s covers off of her. There were
no other interactions between Staff 1 and Youth A.
• I watched video for the other dates Staff 1 supervised
Youth A, dated 7/21/24, 7/22/24, and 7/24/24. There are no
incidents where Staff 1 placed a cockroach on Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• There are policies and procedures pertaining to informally
resolving minor misbehavior, however these do not discuss
any wake up procedures at the facility.
• There were no written plans for Youth A to assist staff at
wake up.
• Staff 1 personnel file has up to date clearances and
trainings. There are no disciplinary actions in the file.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. There is nothing outlined in
the rules or policies that addresses Staff 1’s behavior as non-
compliant. The agency does not have specific procedures for
waking up youth nor did they have a plan for this youth. Staff 1 did
not throw ice cubes at Youth A nor was their evidence to validate
a fake cockroach was placed on her.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered that if a youth in the program is
not following the treatment process, the agency is to provide
instruction and protocol to assist staff in dealing with behaviors
outside of the normal routine. Individual behavioral plans or
assessments, and team meetings can be used to outline specific
interventions for youth on an individual basis.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
